member.name: M:Erp.Contracts.ARInvoiceSvcContract.OnChangeARLOCID(System.String,System.Int32,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@,Erp.Tablesets.ARInvoiceTableset@)
member.summary: This procedure is used to validate the ARLOCID (AR Letter of Credit ID) for both AR Invoice Entry and Posted Invoice Update. The argument "ipInvoiceNum is only supplied when called from Posted Invoice Update. For AR Invoice Entry, if either the Terms or the Bill To Customer is different on the Invoice than it is on the Letter of Credit, a message to the user and a value for the UI to put in that field (if the user decides to) are passed back. When called from Posted Invoice Update, the Customer, Bill To Customer and the Currency must match or an error is given.
member.param: The Letter of Credit ID value
The value to put in the InvcHead.TermsCode field
The message to give the user if the TermsCode needs to be changed
The value to put in the InvcHead.BTCustID field
The message to give the user if the BTCustID needs to be changed

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvGetRecInvSourceRow.InvoiceHeld
member.summary: Invoices that are within a data entry group can be put on "Hold". They will not be posted until InvoiceHeld=No. This flag can be used for whatever the reason the user may wish to keep an invoice in a data entry group from being posted. The Manufacturing System sets this flag when creating invoices for order line items which had been flagged for "Time & Material Invoicing" (OrderDtl.TMBilling)

member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.OpenInvoice
member.summary: Indicates if invoice is "open".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.ClosedDate
member.summary: The latest transaction date (CashDtl) which was available when the invoice was closed. This is used to improve record selection performance when selecting invoices that were open as of a certain date. (Used by the aged invoice report). This is updated during the CashReceipt posting process, Adjustment entry or Apply Credit memos programs..

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CreditMemo
member.summary: Indicates the type of document. Yes = Credit Memo No= Invoice. This value can't be changed after the record has been created. Credit memos affect the way detail quantities and amounts are stored in the database. They will always be stored with a negative sign but will entered as a positive. Credit Memos created by invoice entry also set the InvoiceSuffix field = "CM"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.UnappliedCash
member.summary: An internal flag that represents Credit Memo was due to Unapplied Receipts. Created by the Cash Receipts Entry program. This is only applicable with CreditMemo = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CheckRef
member.summary: The Check reference number that the Unapplied Receipt Credit Memo was created from. Cash receipts entry sets this field equal to the CashHead.CheckRef when it creates the Unapplied Receipt Credit Memo. Primarily used as a reference. This is used when TranType = PrePay, MisPay or PayInv.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceSuffix
member.summary: An internally assigned field that further identifies an invoice. This field will be displayed as a suffix to the invoice number. The possible values are "CM" = Credit memo created by invoice entry, UR = Unapplied Receipt Credit Memo, DN = Debit Note, and FC = Finance Charge invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.GroupID
member.summary: The Group that the invoice was associated with during the data entry process. This field is not directly maintainable, it is assigned by the invoice entry program using the BatchID of the "current " batch that the user is working with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.Posted
member.summary: Indicates if this invoice has been Posted to the receivables file. Only invoices that have been Posted (true) will be included as part of the open receivables, that is they will not appear on reports or inquiries other than those used within invoice entry. Otherwise they are considered as still being in data entry. This field is always "no" when the invoice is created. It is set to "yes" by the "Post function". Once an invoice is posted it can't be maintained via data entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceNum
member.summary: If this field is left blank the system assigns the next available #. The next available # is the greater of last # on file plus one or the XaSyst.StartInvNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceType
member.summary: There are four types of invoices: "Shp" = Invoice for Shipment, "Adv" = Advanced Billing, "Dep" = For Deposit Payments, and "Mis" = Miscellaneous. The setting of this field affects invoice entry: "Shipments" - These are generated by the "Get Shipments function" and is not selectable directly by the user. "Advanced" - Must have a sales order reference. The detail lines on this type of invoice update the OrderDtl.AdvanceBillBal. Also the user indicates if this should be considered as deferred revenue. Which changes which G/L accounts are used for the line item credits. "Deposit" invoices are used to request a "deposit" on an order. A Sales Order is mandatory. No line items or Miscellaneous records are allowed. The user enters a flat amount on the header (InvcHead.PrePayAmt) which will be printed in the body of the invoice. This also updates the OrderHed.PrePayBal field. "Miscellaneous" - These invoices may or may not reference a Sales Order. If Invoice is generated in Project Billing then there are following options: "PFF" - Fixed Fee project; "PCP" - Cost Plus project; "PTM" - Time and Material project; "PPP" - Progress Payment project.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DeferredRevenue
member.summary: Only used when InvoiceType = "Adv" (Advanced Billing). Indicates if the detail line amounts are to be considered as sales or deferred revenue. If "No" then the G/L accounts on the detail lines are the Sales Accounts otherwise they will be set to the Deferred Revenue accounts established in the ARSyst/ARAcct files.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.OrderNum
member.summary: Sales Order #. This is a mandatory entry for all InvoiceType except "Miscellaneous". If entered it must be valid in the OrderHed file. The OrderHed supplies the invoice with many defaults, including; CustNum, PONum, TermsCode, FOB, RepRate, RepSplit, SalesRepList, InvoiceComments

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CustNum
member.summary: The CustNum field is the internal # that is used to link the invoice to the Customer master file. This field is not directly maintained by the user. In most cases it will be duplicated from the referenced OrderHed. For "Miscellaneous" invoices the user can enter either a Sales Order Number or a Customer ID which will supply the CustNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.PONum
member.summary: Customer's PO#. This is a reference field which will be printed on the invoice. Defaults from the OrderHed.PONum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.EntryPerson
member.summary: User ID that entered the invoice. This is not maintainable by the user.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.FOB
member.summary: Defaults from sales order ORderHed.FOB

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.TermsCode
member.summary: Contains the foreign key to the TERMS master file. Defaults from OrderHed if OrderNum > 0 else from the Customer master. This IS A MANDATORY ENTRY. User maintainable via a combo-box for terms description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceDate
member.summary: Invoice date is duplicated from the InvcGrp record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DueDate
member.summary: The due date of the earlist unpaid scheduled payment amount. Normally invoices only have a single due date and amount. However we provide for installment payments which have multiple due dates and associated amounts. When invoices are first created this date will always be equal to the first entry in the DateDueList. Then as transactions are applied this "Current" Due Date is refreshed by figuring out which is the earliest unpaid scheduled payment.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.FiscalYear
member.summary: Fiscal Year is duplicated from the related InvcGrp or based on ShipDate of Packing Slip. This is also refreshed if the InvoiceDate is changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.FiscalPeriod
member.summary: Fiscal period of invoice. This is duplicated in from the InvcBatc or during the "get shipments" function it is determined based on the ShipDate of the packing slip or when the invoice date is changed. It is overrideable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.GLPosted
member.summary: Once posted, maintenance is not allowed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceComment
member.summary: Used to establish invoice comments about the overall order. These will copied into the Invoice detail file as defaults.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceAmt
member.summary: Total invoice Amount. This field is an accumulation of the extended net amounts of the detail line items (InvcDtl) and of the miscellaneous charges/credits (InvcMisc) records. This field has a true sign. (credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DocInvoiceAmt
member.summary: Total invoice Amount. This field is an accumulation of the extended net amounts of the detail line items (InvcDtl) and of the miscellaneous charges/credits (InvcMisc) records. This field has a true sign. (credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DocInvoiceBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.UnpostedBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance which includes the unposted cash receipt amounts. This balance is updated immediately as cash is applied to the invoice, while the InvoiceBal field is not updated until the cash is posted. Used by cash receipts to validate online that an invoice is not over paid. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DocUnpostedBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance which includes the unposted cash receipt amounts. This balance is updated immediately as cash is applied to the invoice, while the InvoiceBal field is not updated until the cash is posted. Used by cash receipts to validate online that an invoice is not over paid. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DepositCredit
member.summary: Amount to be credited against the invoice total due to deposit payments against the sales order. This can be defaulted from OrderHed.DepositBal. This will be printed on the invoice as a separate line "Less Deposit of:" This value updates the OrderHed.DepositBal. Do not allow OrderHed.DepositBal to become negative.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DocDepositCredit
member.summary: Amount to be credited against the invoice total due to deposit payments against the sales order. This can be defaulted from OrderHed.DepositBal. This will be printed on the invoice as a separate line "Less Deposit of:" This value updates the OrderHed.DepositBal. Do not allow OrderHed.DepositBal to become negative.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.SalesRepList
member.summary: Stores the Sales Rep Codes for the invoice. Up to five codes can be established. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead temp widgets are used for entry of each individual code and then put together as one comma delimited string field and assigned to this field. This field will have a Word index, it then will make reporting and data base integrity checking much easier through the use of the "contains phrase" when retrieving records. These codes can be left blank or must be valid in the SalesRep master. The defaults are based on the OrderHed.SalesRepList if a valid Order is referenced or first one is defaulted from the Customer master if ship to is blank else from the ShipTo.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceRef
member.summary:
This field is maintainable/viewable only for Credit Memos. It represents the invoice # that this credit memo relates to. It can be left blank. If entered it must be a valid InvcHead record where the InvcHead.CreditMemo = No. This field is also used to order the invoices when printing aging reports. The idea is to be able to print the credit memos next to their corresponding invoice. Therefore, this field will always have a value.
For Invoices it is equal to the InvoiceNum.
For Credit memos where they are not related to an invoice it is also set equal to the credit memo's InvoiceNum. In this later case when InvcHead.Credit = Yes and InvcHead.InvoiceNum = InvcHead.InvoiceRef the InvoiceRef is reset to zero before being displayed, then when written back to the database it is set = to the InvoiceNum if the user did not enter a related invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RefCancelled
member.summary: Value of this field is reference to invoice which has been cancelled by current invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RefCancelledBy
member.summary: Value of this field is reference to invoice that cancelled this invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.StartUp
member.summary: An internal flag to indicate if this invoice was created by the Open Invoice Load program. These records are not maintainable/viewable via invoice entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.PayDates
member.summary: Contains the "list" of due dates for the scheduled payments. Delimited by the character defined in the "List-Delim" variable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.PayAmounts
member.summary: The scheduled payment amounts. Corresponds with the PayDates list. Delimited by the character defined in the "list-delim" variable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DocPayAmounts
member.summary: The scheduled payment amounts. Corresponds with the PayDates list. Delimited by the character defined in the "list-delim" variable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.PayDiscDate
member.summary: Prompt payment discount date. This is calculated based on the Invoice date + Terms.DiscountDays. Not user maintainable. This will default into the cash receipt record if the scheduled due amount is being paid in full.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.PayDiscAmt
member.summary: Amount of discount that would be given if paid on or before the specified PayDiscDate. Calculated using the Terms.DiscountPercent X Invoice total amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DocPayDiscAmt
member.summary: Amount of discount that would be given if paid on or before the specified PayDiscDate. Calculated using the Terms.DiscountPercent X Invoice total amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.BillConNum
member.summary: Contains the key value for the Billing Contact. This can be blank or it must be valid in the CUSTCNT table. Use the CUSTOMER.PRIMBCON as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.InvoiceHeld
member.summary: Invoices that are within a data entry group can be put on "Hold". They will not be posted until InvoiceHeld=No. This flag can be used for whatever the reason the user may wish to keep an invoice in a data entry group from being posted. The Manufacturing System sets this flag when creating invoices for order line items which had been flagged for "Time & Material Invoicing" (OrderDtl.TMBilling)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CurrencyCode
member.summary: A unique code that identifies the currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.ExchangeRate
member.summary: Exchange rate that will be used for this invoice. Defaults from CurrRate.CurrentRate. Conversion rates will be calculated as System Base = Foreign value * rate, Foreign value = system base * (1/rate). This is the dollar in foreign currency from the exchange rate tables in the newspapers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.LockRate
member.summary: Used with the currency module. When TRUE the currency rate can be changed by the user and cannot be changed by the system. This will also be the default for the invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.JournalNum
member.summary: Journal number that invoice was posted to. This can also be thought of as the Voucher Number. If ARSyst.ARVoucherInvoices = Yes then this value will be printed on the Invoice. Note: applicable only when posted to G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.JournalCode
member.summary: Journal that invoice was posted to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.LineType
member.summary: Used to differentiate between invoiced with standard lines which are for parts "PART" and lines for service calls "CALL" .

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RMANum
member.summary: The RMA number which generated this Credit Memo. Note: This only applies to Credit Memos. It is assigned as part of the Request Credit process for an RMA and is not directly maintainable by Invoice Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.Plant
member.summary: The Site that the invoice is relate to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CardMemberName
member.summary: The member's name on the credit card.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CardNumber
member.summary: The credit card account identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CardType
member.summary: A code assigned by the user to uniquely identify a Credit Card Type master. This can't be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.ExpirationMonth
member.summary: The expiration month of the credit card.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.ExpirationYear
member.summary: The expiration year of the credit card.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CardID
member.summary: Optional field, a 4-digit, non-embossed code on face of American Express Card assigned for fraud prevention.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.CardmemberReference
member.summary: Up to 17 alphnumeric characters provided by customer. This is used to track information on customer spending (e.g., cost center, project code). This field is especially critical, since inaccurate information will affect the general ledger. If no reference number is provided, leave this field blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.LegalNumber
member.summary: The Legal Number for the record. This number is created based on setup parameters in table LegalNumber.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.ExternalID
member.summary: External Identifier

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.XRefInvoiceNum
member.summary: Cross reference invoice number used when converting data from another ERP system when the previous system data has alphanumeric content. This field is not used by MfgSys. This field can be used in searches and can be added to screens through customization.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DepGainLoss
member.summary: Wherever the Less Advanced or Less Deposited is calculated, put any gain-loss difference into this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DNComments
member.summary: For the Debit Note invoices this field contains the detail comments for the Debit Note. For the regular invoices this field contains the list of Debit Notes related to this invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DNCustNbr
member.summary: For the Debit Note invoice this field contains A Debit Note number assigned by the customer. The Debit Note number is supposed to be unique for the customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.DebitNote
member.summary: Indicates the type of documents. Yes = Debit Note. This value can't be changed (the record is created on Invoice payment posting). Debit Notes also have the InvoiceSuffix field = "DN".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.SoldToCustNum
member.summary: This is populated from ShipHead.CustNum representing the Sold To customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.Consolidated
member.summary: Default is false. This is only set to true if this invoice was generated via Get Shipments and shipments were combined based on common Bill To customer. This is used by ARInvoice Entry to properly enable/disable Bill To customer field (InvcHead.CustNum) and to identify the record as a consolidated Invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.BillToInvoiceAddress
member.summary: If InvcHead.CustNum (BillTo) is different from InvcHead.SoldToCustNum (SoldTo), then this field defaults to the CustBillTo (Alt BillTo). InvoiceAddress status and SoldToInvoiceAddress is set to the opposite status.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.SoldToInvoiceAddress
member.summary: Always the opposite status of BillToInvoiceAddress. If true, Invoice address for printing will use the Bill To address on the Sold-to customer. If false, will use the Bill To address of the Bill to customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.ProcessCard
member.summary: Stores the encrypted credit card number

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepComm1
member.summary: Contains the total commission amount for the corresponding sales rep (SalesRepList). This total is NOT MAINTAINABLE. It is updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain this total; If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount) * RepSplit) * RepRate).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepComm2
member.summary: Contains the total commission amount for the corresponding sales rep (SalesRepList). This total is NOT MAINTAINABLE. It is updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain this total; If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount) * RepSplit) * RepRate).

The following basic formula is used to maintain this total; If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount) * RepSplit) * RepRate).

The following basic formula is used to maintain this total; If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount) * RepSplit) * RepRate).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepRate1
member.summary: Establishes the default commission rates used for invoice line items. Defaults to OrderHed.RepRate if related to sales order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepRate2
member.summary: Establishes the default commission rates used for invoice line items. Defaults to OrderHed.RepRate if related to sales order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepRate3
member.summary: Establishes the default commission rates used for invoice line items. Defaults to OrderHed.RepRate if related to sales order.

member.summary: Establishes the default commission rates used for invoice line items. Defaults to OrderHed.RepRate if related to sales order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepRate5
member.summary: Establishes the default commission rates used for invoice line items. Defaults to OrderHed.RepRate if related to sales order.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepSales1
member.summary: An array of five elements containing the total invoice sales amount for the corresponding sales reps (SalesRepList). These totals are NOT MAINTAINABLE. They are updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain these totals: If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount . NOTE: miscellaneous charges/credits are NOT part of the sales total.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepSales2
member.summary: An array of five elements containing the total invoice sales amount for the corresponding sales reps (SalesRepList). These totals are NOT MAINTAINABLE. They are updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain these totals: If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount . NOTE: miscellaneous charges/credits are NOT part of the sales total.

member.summary: An array of five elements containing the total invoice sales amount for the corresponding sales reps (SalesRepList). These totals are NOT MAINTAINABLE. They are updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain these totals: If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount . NOTE: miscellaneous charges/credits are NOT part of the sales total.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepSales4
member.summary: An array of five elements containing the total invoice sales amount for the corresponding sales reps (SalesRepList). These totals are NOT MAINTAINABLE. They are updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain these totals: If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount . NOTE: miscellaneous charges/credits are NOT part of the sales total.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.RepSales5
member.summary: An array of five elements containing the total invoice sales amount for the corresponding sales reps (SalesRepList). These totals are NOT MAINTAINABLE. They are updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain these totals: If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount . NOTE: miscellaneous charges/credits are NOT part of the sales total.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadRow.ReadyToCalc
member.summary: This flag will be used to indicate if the invoice is ready for calculations. When set to true, tax calculations will take place whenever a save takes place for any tables tied to the invoice which could affect taxes (InvcDtl, InvcHead, InvcMisc, etc). It defaults from ARSyst.InvcReadyToCalcDflt field when an invoice is created.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InvoiceNum
member.summary: Foreign key to the InvcHead.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InvoiceLine
member.summary: This field along with Company and InvoiceNum make up the unique key to the table. The system generates this number during entry of new detail records. The system determines next available number by finding the last InvcDtl record for the Invoice and adding 1 to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.LineType
member.summary: Used to differentiate between standard lines which are for parts "PART" and lines for service contracts "CONTRACT" and line for service calls "CALL".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ContractNum
member.summary: Contract Number of the related Service Contract when the LineType field is "CONTRACT"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.XPartNum
member.summary: An optional field that is used if the customer has a different Part number than the internal part number. This field is defaulted from the OrderDtl or ShipDtl files.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.XRevisionNum
member.summary: Optional field that contains the customers revision. Default from the ShipDtl.XRevisionNum for shipment lines or from OrderDtl.XRevisionNum, otherwise left blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.PartNum
member.summary: Part number used to identify line item part. This would be used as "Our" part number if there is a difference between us and the customers part numbering scheme. Defaults from the OrderDtl.PartNum or the ShipDtl.PartNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.LineDesc
member.summary: Description of the line item. Defaults from ShipDtl.LineDesc, OrderDtl.LineDesc or Part.PartDescription.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.IUM
member.summary: Unit Of Measure. Defaulted from ShipDtl.IUM, OrderRel.IUM or Part.IUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.RevisionNum
member.summary: Our Current Revision Number for this Part.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.POLine
member.summary: Contains the line reference of the item on the customers PO. This is for reference and printing purposes. Defaults from the OrderDtl.POLine.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.TaxExempt
member.summary: Indicates if this customer is exempt from sales tax for this line item. If field is non-blank it is considered exempt. This code is totally user definable and no validation is required. This field will be printed on the Tax report if this item is reportable. When the value is changed from blank to non-blank or vice versa tax calculation logic kicks in to calculate the sales tax info in the InvcTax file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.TaxCatID
member.summary: Indicates the Tax Category for this record. Defaults from the OrderDtl if related to an Order or from the Part Master.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.Commissionable
member.summary: Indicates if this line is commissionable for the related sales rep's. Defaults from the OrderDtl. Note: "Deposit" invoice is always No.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DiscountPercent
member.summary: Unit price discount percent. User can enter a percentage and the system calculates the discount amount. NOT MAINTAINABLE & zero if Advance Bill.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.UnitPrice
member.summary: Unit Price. Can be defaulted from the OrderDtl.UnitPrice. Always zero and not maintainable if this is a progress billing type of invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocUnitPrice
member.summary: Unit Price. Can be defaulted from the OrderDtl.UnitPrice. Always zero and not maintainable if this is a progress billing type of invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.PricePerCode
member.summary: Indicates the pricing per quantity. It can be "E" = per each, "C" = per hundred, "M" = per thousand. Used to calculate the extended unit price for the line item. The logic is to divide the InvcDtl.ShipQty by the appropriate "per" value and then multiply by unit price. Use the OrderDtl.PricePerCode as default if referenced to an order else use Part.PricePerCode as a default. If Part record does not exist then default as "E".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.OurOrderQty
member.summary: The planned order release quantity. This is not maintainable. If and only if an order is referenced then it is set equal to the OrderRel.OurReqQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ExtPrice
member.summary: Extended Price for the invoice line item. If not a ProgressBill or "Deposit" invoice then it is not maintainable and is calculated as the (ShipQty/PricePer) * UnitPrice. If it is a ProgressBill or "Deposit Invoice" then the ShipQty and UnitPrice fields are zero and the user is allowed entry to this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocExtPrice
member.summary: Extended Price for the invoice line item. If not a ProgressBill or "Deposit" invoice then it is not maintainable and is calculated as the (ShipQty/PricePer) * UnitPrice. If it is a ProgressBill or "Deposit Invoice" then the ShipQty and UnitPrice fields are zero and the user is allowed entry to this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.Discount
member.summary: A flat discount amount for the line item. It can be zero. This is calculated using the DiscountPercent * (ShipQty * UnitPrice)). This field can also be directly updated by the user, however it is refreshed whenever the DiscountPercent, UnitPrice or ShipQty fields are changed. Discount CANNOT EXCEED THE EXTENDED LINE AMOUNT. Note a discount entered here reduces the "net" sale amount, while miscellaneous amounts are not. NOT MAINTAINABLE & Zero if ProgressBill.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocDiscount
member.summary: A flat discount amount for the line item. It can be zero. This is calculated using the DiscountPercent * (ShipQty * UnitPrice)). This field can also be directly updated by the user, however it is refreshed whenever the DiscountPercent, UnitPrice or ShipQty fields are changed. Discount CANNOT EXCEED THE EXTENDED LINE AMOUNT. Note a discount entered here reduces the "net" sale amount, while miscellaneous amounts are not. NOT MAINTAINABLE & Zero if ProgressBill.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.TotalMiscChrg
member.summary: Non-Maintainable. Rolled up total of all misc. charge records for this invoice detail line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocTotalMiscChrg
member.summary: Non-Maintainable. Rolled up total of all misc. charge records for this invoice detail line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ProdCode
member.summary: Contains the foreign key to the ProdGrup file. Can be blank or must be valid. Defaults from the OrderDtl or Part file.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.OurShipQty
member.summary: Our Quantity Shipped/billed. Can be defaulted from ShipDtl.OurShipQty. Not maintainable & Zero for ProgressBill.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.PackNum
member.summary: Packing slip number that this detail record is linked with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.PackLine
member.summary: The packing slip line number that is being invoiced.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.OrderNum
member.summary: Sales Order number. This is not maintainable by the user. The system duplicates it from the InvcHead.OrderNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.OrderLine
member.summary: The associated sales order line number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.OrderRelNum
member.summary: Contains the release number of the order line item that is being invoiced.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ShipToCustNum
member.summary: Ship To Customer Number. This along with ShipToNum provides the foreign key field to a given ShipTo. Normally this has the same value as the CustNum field. However, if the customer allows 3rd party shipto (Customer.AllowShipTo3) then this could be a different custnum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ShipToNum
member.summary: Customer Ship To ID for the item. Defaults from the Customer, OrderRel or ShipDtl records. If invoice details reference only one ship to then the ship to info is printed as heading info. otherwise a "See Below" message is printed and the Ship To info is printed as part of the invoice detail body.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ShipDate
member.summary: Ship date of the invoice line item. Defaults from the ShipHead or from the invoice date when not referencing a packing slip. When printed on the invoice it is printed as part of the heading if only one date exists else it is printed as part of the detail line.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ShipViaCode
member.summary: ShipVia for the invoice detail lines. Contains the Foreign key to the SHIPVIA master file. Can be left blank or must be valid. Default from the OrderRel, ShipHead, Customer or ShipTo. If invoice contains only a single ship via then it is printed as part of the heading; otherwise, it prints as part of the line item detail.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.AdvanceBillCredit
member.summary: The amount this line item that is reduced by due to prior advanced billings. This is only valid for "Shipment" or Miscellaneous" types. It is defaulted from the OrderDtl.AdvanceBillBal. This value reduces the OrderDtl.AdvanceBillBal.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocAdvanceBillCredit
member.summary: The amount this line item that is reduced by due to prior advanced billings. This is only valid for "Shipment" or Miscellaneous" types. It is defaulted from the OrderDtl.AdvanceBillBal. This value reduces the OrderDtl.AdvanceBillBal.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.CustNum
member.summary: The CustNum field is the internal number that is used to link the invoice to the Customer master file. This is not maintainable, it is duplicated from the InvcHead.CustNum field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InvoiceComment
member.summary: Used to enter comments about the invoice line item. These are printed on the invoice. When invoice is referenced to a sales order line then this is defaulted from OrderDtl.InvoiceComment.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ShpConNum
member.summary: Contains the key value for the shipping contact in the CUSTCNT table. Can be blank or must be valid in the CUSTCNT table. Use the Customer.PrimSCon as a default or from OrderRel record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.MtlUnitCost
member.summary: Material Unit Cost. The cost is initially captured on the PartTran record for the shipments (MFG-CUS, STK-CUS). It is duplicated from the PartTran when invoiced. If shipped from inventory then it is the cost captured from the part master at time of shipment. If shipped from job it is calculated during the Calculate WIP/COS period end process. Note: the Calculate WIP/COS will also update this cost for invoiced job shipments which had been invoiced prior to having the costs calculated.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.LbrUnitCost
member.summary: Labor Unit Cost. The cost is initially captured on the PartTran record for the shipments (MFG-CUS, STK-CUS). It is duplicated from the PartTran when invoiced. If shipped from inventory then it is the cost captured from the part master at time of shipment. If shipped from job it is calculated during the Calculate WIP/COS period end process. Note: the Calculate WIP/COS will also update this cost for invoiced job shipments which had been invoiced prior to having the costs calculated.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.BurUnitCost
member.summary: Burden Unit Cost. The cost is initially captured on the PartTran record for the shipments (MFG-CUS, STK-CUS). It is duplicated from the PartTran when invoiced. If shipped from inventory then it is the cost captured from the part master at time of shipment. If shipped from job it is calculated during the Calculate WIP/COS period end process. Note: the Calculate WIP/COS will also update this cost for invoiced job shipments which had been invoiced prior to having the costs calculated.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.SubUnitCost
member.summary: Subcontract Unit Cost. If shipped from inventory then it is zero. (Subcontract cost is combined with material cost on part master) The cost is initially captured on the PartTran record for the shipments (MFG-CUS, STK-CUS). It is duplicated from the PartTran when invoiced. If shipped from inventory then it is the cost captured from the part master at time of shipment. If shipped from job it is calculated during the Calculate WIP/COS period end process. Note: the Calculate WIP/COS will also update this cost for invoiced job shipments which had been invoiced prior to having the costs calculated.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.MtlBurUnitCost
member.summary: Material Burden Unit Cost. The cost is initially captured on the PartTran record for the shipments (MFG-CUS, STK-CUS). It is duplicated from the PartTran when invoiced. If shipped from inventory then it is the cost captured from the part master at time of shipment. If shipped from job it is calculated during the Calculate WIP/COS period end process. Note: the Calculate WIP/COS will also update this cost for invoiced job shipments which had been invoiced prior to having the costs calculated.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.COSPostingReqd
member.summary: Answers the question, "Does this InvcDtl need to have cost of sales posted to G/L?" If the Manufacturing System is not using a A/R clearing account (XASyst.ARClearingDiv = "") then the costs were already posted to the Cost Of Sales account by the COS/WIP procedure (JCP80.W), so there are no costs to move.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.COSPosted
member.summary: If the amount of this InvcDtl was posted to the A/R clearing account (COSPostingReq = Yes), then at sometime the amount needs to be moved to the COS account. When the costs are moved, this flag is set to Yes. When a product is shipped it's costs are put in A/R Clearing. When it's invoiced the costs are ready to be moved to COS. The Capture WIP/COS Activity procedure (JCP80.W) moves these costs.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ContractCode
member.summary: A unique code that identifies the Service Contract when the Line Type is "CONTRACT"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.CallNum
member.summary: this is a link to the service call that this invoice is for. Linetype = "CALL"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.CallCode
member.summary: A unique code that identifies the type of service call. Link to GL accounts when LineType = "CALL"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.RMANum
member.summary: The related RMA number. Note: This only applies to Credit Memos. It is assigned as part of the Request Credit process for an RMA and is not directly maintainable by Invoice Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.RMALine
member.summary: The related RMA Line number. This along with the RMANum provides the foreign key to the related RMADtl record. (See InvcDtl.RMANum)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.SalesCatID
member.summary: A Cod which uniquely identfies SalesCat record. Can't be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.FiscalYear
member.summary: Fiscal year that clearing/cos entry was posted to in G/L. Note: The Fiscal Year, Period, Journal Code, JournalNum pertain only to records which were used to post to the ARClearing/COS. This condition is indicated if COSPostingReqd = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.FiscalPeriod
member.summary: Fiscal period that entry was posted to. Note: applicable only when posted to G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.JournalCode
member.summary: Journal Code of the related GLJrnDtl. Note: This is set as the Inventory Journal code defined in the inventory configuration options.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.JournalNum
member.summary: Journal # that entry was posted to. Note: applicable only when posted to G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.SellingOrderQty
member.summary: The planned order release quantity. This is not maintainable. If and only if an order is referenced then it is set equal to the OrderRel.SellingReqQty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.SellingShipQty
member.summary: Selling Quantity Shipped/billed. Can be defaulted from ShipDtl.SellingShipQty. Not maintainable & Zero for ProgressBill.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.SalesUM
member.summary: Selling Unit Of Measure. Defaulted from ShipDtl.SUM, OrderDtl.SUM or Part.SUM.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.SellingFactor
member.summary:
This value is used to convert quantity when there is a difference in the customers unit of measure and how it is stocked in inventory. Example is sold in pounds, stocked in sheets.
Formula: Inventory Qty * Conversion Factor = Selling Qty.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.ProjectID
member.summary: Project Id that links the invoice detail to the Project table.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.MilestoneID
member.summary: Milestone id that links the invoice detail to the ProjectMilestone.

member.summary: Indicates how Factor is used in calculations. If M (multiply), the Factor is multiplied, if D (divide) the factor is divided.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InUnitPrice
member.summary: Unit Price including taxes. Can be defaulted from the OrderDtl.InUnitPrice. Always zero and not maintainable if this is a progress billing type of invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocInUnitPrice
member.summary: Unit Price including taxes. Can be defaulted from the OrderDtl.InUnitPrice. Always zero and not maintainable if this is a progress billing type of invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InExtPrice
member.summary: Extended Price for the invoice line item including taxes. If not a ProgressBill or "Deposit" invoice then it is not maintainable and is calculated as the (ShipQty/PricePer) * UnitPrice. If it is a ProgressBill or "Deposit Invoice" then the ShipQty and UnitPrice fields are zero and the user is allowed entry to this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocInExtPrice
member.summary: Extended Price for the invoice line item including taxes. If not a ProgressBill or "Deposit" invoice then it is not maintainable and is calculated as the (ShipQty/PricePer) * UnitPrice. If it is a ProgressBill or "Deposit Invoice" then the ShipQty and UnitPrice fields are zero and the user is allowed entry to this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InDiscount
member.summary: A flat discount amount for the line item including taxes. It can be zero. This is calculated using the DiscountPercent * (ShipQty * InUnitPrice)). This field can also be directly updated by the user, however it is refreshed whenever the DiscountPercent, InUnitPrice or ShipQty fields are changed. Discount CANNOT EXCEED THE EXTENDED LINE AMOUNT. Note a discount entered here reduces the "net" sale amount, while miscellaneous amounts are not. NOT MAINTAINABLE & Zero if ProgressBill.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocInDiscount
member.summary: A flat discount amount for the line item including taxes. It can be zero. This is calculated using the DiscountPercent * (ShipQty * InUnitPrice)). This field can also be directly updated by the user, however it is refreshed whenever the DiscountPercent, InUnitPrice or ShipQty fields are changed. Discount CANNOT EXCEED THE EXTENDED LINE AMOUNT. Note a discount entered here reduces the "net" sale amount, while miscellaneous amounts are not. NOT MAINTAINABLE & Zero if ProgressBill.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InTotalMiscChrg
member.summary: Non-Maintainable. Rolled up total of all misc. charge records for this invoice detail line (includes taxes).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocInTotalMiscChrg
member.summary: Non-Maintainable. Rolled up total of all misc. charge records for this invoice detail line (includes taxes).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InListPrice
member.summary: This is the unit price returned by the price list before quantity based or order value based discounts are applied (includes taxes). Will default from the OrderDtl.InListPrice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocInListPrice
member.summary: This is the list price in customer currency. Will default from the OrderDtl.DocInListPrice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.InOrdBasedPrice
member.summary: This is the unit price after quantity based or order value based discounts are applied (includes taxes). Will default from the OrderDtl.InOrdBasedPrice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlRow.DocInOrdBasedPrice
member.summary: This is the order based price in customer currency. Will default from the OrderDtl.DocInOrdBasedPrice.

member.summary: Part of the foreign key used to relate back to a InvcDtl or InvcMisc record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.TaxCode
member.summary: Descriptive code assigned by user which uniquely identifies a Sales Tax master record. Can't be blank. This is used as a foreign key in other files and may be used in displays/reports where space for the full description is limited.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.ReportableAmt
member.summary: The reportable sales amount to the tax jurisdiction. Set the value as follows; first determine if the item needs to be reported to the tax jurisdiction. This is done by using the InvcDtl.TaxCode and InvcDtl/InvcMisc.TaxCat to find a record in the SalesTxC. If a record is not found or SalesTxC.Reportable = Yes then add in the line item extended amount ((Qty*unitprice)-discount) or if this is for a InvcMisc record InvcMisc.Amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.DocReportableAmt
member.summary: The reportable sales amount to the tax jurisdiction. Set the value as follows; first determine if the item needs to be reported to the tax jurisdiction. This is done by using the InvcDtl.TaxCode and InvcDtl/InvcMisc.TaxCat to find a record in the SalesTxC. If a record is not found or SalesTxC.Reportable = Yes then add in the line item extended amount ((Qty*unitprice)-discount) or if this is for a InvcMisc record InvcMisc.Amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.TaxableAmt
member.summary: Taxable Amount for this line item/Misc charge. This value is set as an accumulation of non-exempt sales amount from the line and its associated miscellaneous records. It could be tax exempt for two reasons, either the customer is exempt (invcdtl.TaxExempt > blank) or the item is exempt. In either case the detail amounts would not be added into the taxable amount. To see if the item is exempt use the InvcDt/InvcMisc.TaxCat and the InvcTax.TaxCode to find a record in the SalesTxC. If a record is found then it is exempt.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.DocTaxableAmt
member.summary: Taxable Amount for this line item/Misc charge. This value is set as an accumulation of non-exempt sales amount from the line and its associated miscellaneous records. It could be tax exempt for two reasons, either the customer is exempt (invcdtl.TaxExempt > blank) or the item is exempt. In either case the detail amounts would not be added into the taxable amount. To see if the item is exempt use the InvcDt/InvcMisc.TaxCat and the InvcTax.TaxCode to find a record in the SalesTxC. If a record is found then it is exempt.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.Percent
member.summary: The tax percentage rate that is used for this invoice. This is defaulted from the SalesTax.Percent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.TaxAmt
member.summary: Sales Tax amount for the corresponding taxable sales amount. This is user maintainable and also defaulted when/if the user changes the tax code, tax percent or the taxable amount or the tax classification changes to non-taxable when the InvcDtl.TaxCat is changed. They can override the calculated figure to provide for any tax calculations other than the simple percent of taxable. No tax is calculated when the InvcDtl.TaxExempt <> blank or a record is found in the SalesTxC file indicating that this item is not taxable. Otherwise it is calculated as TaxableAmt * Percent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.DocTaxAmt
member.summary: Sales Tax amount for the corresponding taxable sales amount. This is user maintainable and also defaulted when/if the user changes the tax code, tax percent or the taxable amount or the tax classification changes to non-taxable when the InvcDtl.TaxCat is changed. They can override the calculated figure to provide for any tax calculations other than the simple percent of taxable. No tax is calculated when the InvcDtl.TaxExempt <> blank or a record is found in the SalesTxC file indicating that this item is not taxable. Otherwise it is calculated as TaxableAmt * Percent.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcTaxRow.Manual
member.summary: Indicates if the tax calculations are to be performed manually. When this field is set the Reportable, Taxable, and TaxAmount fields are enabled. When it is NOT set these fields are DISABLED and the system will perform all of the Reportable, Taxable, and TaxAmount calculations. Defaults from the SalesTax.Manual field.

member.summary: Used to allow a second tax record using the same tax code on an invoice. When the sales tax field EcAquisition is checked then 2 invoice tax records are created. NOTE: This field is now used in VAT Reverse Charge logic. If an invoice line is marked for Reverse Charge, a second line is created just like in the ECAcquisition logic. member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.RelatedToFile
member.summary: Identifies the master file to which the GL Control is related to. This field is used to properly isolate controls to the masters they are related to. For example; Customer, PartClass identifies controls that are related to Customers and Part Classes

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.Key1
member.summary: Major component of the foreign key of the related master record. For example: For a "PORel" control this field would contain the related PO Number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.Key2
member.summary: 2nd component of the foreign key to the related master record. For example: For a "PORel" control this field would contain the related PO Line Number. The usage of this field is dependent on the type of record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.Key3
member.summary: 3rd component of the foreign key to the related master record. For example: For a "PORel" control this field would contain the related PO Release Number. The usage of this field is dependent record type.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.Key4
member.summary: 4th component of the foreign key to the related master record. The usage of this field is dependent record type.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.Key5
member.summary: 5th component of the foreign key to the related master record. The usage of this field is dependent record type.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.Key6
member.summary: 6th component of the foreign key to the related master record. The usage of this field is dependent record type.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.TGLCTranNum
member.summary: Internal identifier used to keep records unique for the related record. The system generates this number by finding the last TranGLC record for the RelatedToFile-Key1-Key2 etc. and adding 1 to it.

member.summary: The chart of account code used by the book. Will contain the Master COA when BookID is blank. Reference only. Used for integrity checking when updating/deleting a GL account.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcDtlTGLCRow.GLAccount

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.GroupID
member.summary: The data entry "Group" to which is transaction is assigned. This is not user maintainable. It is duplicated from the corresponding CashHead record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.HeadNum
member.summary: The foreign key that relates this detail record to a CashHead record. Duplicated from CashHead.HeadNum when record is created. Not applicable to user interface.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.InvoiceNum
member.summary: The open A/R invoice # that the transaction applies against. Not used by the MisPay trantype. In the case of PayInv, or CMemo transaction this must be a valid InvcHead record where InvcHead.CreditMemo = No. In case of "Adjust" transactions this can be either a invoice or a credit memo reference. Note: The "Apply Credit Memo" program automatically creates an additional CashDtl records for each invoice to which the credit memo is applied. In this additional record this field contains the credit memo's number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.InvoiceRef
member.summary: Applicable to CMemo transaction types only. The "Apply Credit Memo" program creates two CashDtl records for each invoice that a credit memo is applied to. One record for the <credit> to the invoice and a second record for the debit to the credit memo. In the first record this field is the InvoiceNum of the Credit memo. In the second record it is the InvoiceNum of the invoice that the credit memo was applied to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.TranType
member.summary: Identifies the type of transaction. Adjust = Adjustment, CMemo = Credit Memo Transfer, PrePay = Pre Payment, MisPay = Misc Payment, PayInv = Payment on Invoices. This is duplicated from the CashHead.TranType, not user maintainable. Note: For currency gain/loss it will be "Adjust". Both the Debit/Credit GL# will be used. Debit is A/R account. Credit is gain/loss account.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.Posted
member.summary: A flag that indicates if this transaction has been posted. A posted transaction cannot be maintained; it is considered as being committed. This flag is not directly set by the user for each transaction. Instead it is set via a "post function" which processes all the transactions in the batch.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.FiscalYear
member.summary: Fiscal Year. This is not entered by the user on each record. Instead as part of the posting process it is duplicated in from the CashBatc.FiscalYear. Therefore each batch is posted to a single fiscal period.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.FiscalPeriod
member.summary: Fiscal period for the transaction. Not directly entered by the user. Duplicated from the CashBatc.FiscalPeriod at time of posting.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.GLPosted
member.summary: Indicates if this transaction has been posted to the General Ledger Module.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.TranDate
member.summary: Transaction Date. Duplicated from the CashBatc.TranDate. Not user maintainable. This is refreshed as part of the post process.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.CheckRef
member.summary: The customer's Check number of the receipt transaction. Duplicated from CashHead.CheckRef. This is a mandatory field used only for Cash Receipt type of translations. Primarily used as a reference. The only validation is that it can't be blank. This is used when TranType = PrePay, MisPay or PayInv.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.TranAmt
member.summary: Amount of transaction that is being applied. Default as the lesser of IncvHead.InvoiceBal or CashHead.Outstanding. Notes on sign of field: For Cash receipt transaction it carries a positive sign. For Adjustments it carries the sign entered by the user (negatives reduce A/R). For disbursement of a credit memo against invoices (CMEMO) the transactions against the invoice carry a negative sign and the transactions generated against the credit memo carry a positive sign. For records based in Debit Note applied it carries a negative sign.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.DocTranAmt
member.summary: Amount of transaction that is being applied. Default as the lesser of IncvHead.InvoiceBal or CashHead.Outstanding. Notes on sign of field: For Cash receipt transaction, it carries a positive sign. For Adjustments it carries the sign entered by the user (negatives reduce A/R). For disbursement of a credit memo against invoices (CMEMO) the transactions against the invoice carry a negative sign and the transactions generated against the credit memo carry a positive sign.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.CustNum
member.summary: Contains the Customer number that the transaction is for. This must be valid in the Customer table. Not entered for miscellaneous receipts.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.Discount
member.summary: Prompt Payment Discount given for this invoice. Only applicable for PayInv trantype. The (TranAmt - Discount) reduces the Outstanding amount of the CashHead.TranAmt left to be applied. This can't be > TranAmt.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.DocDiscount
member.summary: Prompt Payment Discount given for this invoice. Only applicable for PayInv trantype. The (TranAmt - Discount) reduces the Outstanding amount of the CashHead.TranAmt left to be applied. This can't be > TranAmt.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.Comment
member.summary: Allows user to enter comments about the transaction. This is only applicable with TranType = "Adjust".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.Reference
member.summary: Allows user to enter a short descriptive reference for the transaction. This is useful with Miscellaneous Cash Receipts.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.ExchangeRate
member.summary: Exchange rate that will be used for this CashDtl, only differs from cashead when the invoice is locked. Defaults from CurrRate.CurrentRate. Conversion rates will be calculated as System Base = Foreign value * rate, Foreign value = system base * (1/rate). This is the dollar in foreign currency from the exchange rate tables in the newspapers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.LegalNumber
member.summary: The Legal Number for the record. This number is created based on setup parameters in table LegalNumber.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ARInvPayActivityRow.GLRefType
member.summary: Link to the related GLRefTyp.RefType.

member.summary: Link to the related Code in GLRefCod.RefCode

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcReminderRow.DueDate
member.summary: The due date of the earlist unpaid scheduled payment amount. Normally invoices only have a single due date and amount. However we provide for installment payments which have multiple due dates and associated amounts. When invoices are first created this date will always be equal to the first entry in the DateDueList. Then as transactions are applied this "Current" Due Date is refreshed by figuring out which is the earliest unpaid scheduled payment.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcReminderRow.InvoiceAmt
member.summary: Total invoice Amount. This field is an accumulation of the extended net amounts of the detail line items (InvcDtl) and of the miscellaneous charges/credits (InvcMisc) records. This field has a true sign. (credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcReminderRow.InvoiceBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.TransactionID
member.summary: This value will come from Avalara ValidateResult TransactionID and identifies a unique specific request/response set. It will be used to tie the ETCValidAddress and ETCMessage rows to ETCAddress.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.UpdateAllowed
member.summary: This field will be set if by the process calling address validation to indicate whether the user should have the option to update the original address within the address validation UI.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.RequestID
member.summary: Programmatically assign unique key to tie the ETCAddress table, the ETCValidAddress table and the ETCMessages table together.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddressCode
member.summary: Programmatically determined value used internally by the adapter. Defaults to the hash code of the Address object.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddressType
member.summary: The type of address that was coded (PO Box, Rural Route, and so on), using the input address. This probably needs Code/desc data Avalara will return F = Firm or company address; G = General Delivery address; H= High-rise or business complex; P = PO Box address; R = Rural route address; S = Street or residential address

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.CarrierRoute
member.summary: The carrier route associated with the input address (USA). This probably needs Code/desc data Avalara will return B = PO Box; C = City Delivery; G= General Delivery; H = Highway Contract; R = Rural route.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidCity
member.summary: City name

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidCountry
member.summary: Country name

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.County
member.summary: County name

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.FipsCode
member.summary: Federal Information Processing Standards Code (USA). This is a unique code representing each geographic combination of state, county, and city. The code is made up of the Federal Information Processing Code (FIPS) that uniquely identifies each state, county, and city in the U.S. See Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) Codes for more details. Digits 1-2 are the state code, digits 3-5 are the county code and digits 6-10 are the city code.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine1
member.summary: Line one of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine2
member.summary: Line two of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine3
member.summary: Line three of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidLine4
member.summary: Line four of the valid address returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidPostalCode
member.summary: Postal code returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.PostNet
member.summary: A 12-digit POSTNet barcode (USA). Digits 1-5 = ZIP code, digits 6-9 = Plus4 Code, digits 10-11 = delivery point, digit 12 = check digit

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ValidRegion
member.summary: State or province name or abbreviation returned by the tax integration.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ResultCode
member.summary: This needs Code/desc data. Avalara will return a single code for each address validation request. We will include the result code in each ETCValidAddress row. Success = Operation Succeeded; Warning = Warnings occured, operation succeeded, Error = Errors occured, operation failed; Exception = Unexpected exceptions occurred, operation failed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ResultSeq
member.summary: This is an additional field to set a unique sequence for each ValidMessage returned for a specific TransactionId.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.CarrierRouteDesc
member.summary: Carrier Route description

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.AddressTypeDesc
member.summary: Address type description

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.CountryNum
member.summary: A unique integer assigned by the system to new countries by the maintenance program. This field is used as the foreign key to identify the country in other files such as Customer, or vendor. The end user should never need to know about the value of this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.InvoiceNum
member.summary: Foreign key to the InvcHead.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.InvoiceLine
member.summary: This field along with Company and InvoiceNum make up the unique key to the table. The system generates this number during entry of new detail records. The system determines next available number by finding the last InvcDtl record for the Invoice and adding 1 to it.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCAddressRow.ACWPercentage
member.summary: Auto consume window percentage: this is a percentage to calculate the auto consume window days that scheduling engine will take in consideration to look for available quantity to consume. The purpose of this is to look ahead for a few days that will save more time than building the goods, so unless we get the full qty current date we need to use the window to look for the remaining.

member.summary: RowMod

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.ETCMessageRow.Source

member.summary: This is an additional field to contain an appropriate piece of data to be used with the AddrSource for display in the UI to clarify for the user what data the validated address relates to. Such as AddrSource = Customer and AddrSourceID = ?Addison?

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.SoldToCustNum
member.summary: Sold to customer number.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.Consolidated
member.summary: This is only set to true if this invoice was generated via Get Shipments and shipments were combined based on common Bill To customer. This is used by ARInvoice Entry to properly enable/disable Bill To customer field (InvcHead.CustNum) and to identify the record as a consolidated Invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.BillToInvoiceAddress
member.summary: If InvcHead.CustNum (BillTo) is different from InvcHead.SoldToCustNum (SoldTo), then this field defaults to the CustBillTo (Alt BillTo). InvoiceAddress status and SoldToInvoiceAddress is set to the opposite status.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.SoldToInvoiceAddress
member.summary: Always the opposite status of BillToInvoiceAddress. If true, Invoice address for printing will use the Bill To address on the Sold-to customer. If false, will use the Bill To address of the Bill to customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.SoldToCustID

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.DNCustNbr
member.summary: For Debit Note type invoice this is the Debit Note Number assigned by the customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.DNComments
member.summary: For the regular invoices this field contains the list of Debit Notes related to this invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.CustID
member.summary: Bill to customer ID.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.CustName
