member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcCustTrkRow.SpecifiedProperties
member.summary: SpecifiedProperties

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.Company
member.summary: Company Identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.OpenInvoice
member.summary: Indicates if invoice is "open".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.ClosedDate
member.summary: The latest transaction date (CashDtl) which was available when the invoice was closed. This is used to improve record selection performance when selecting invoices that were open as of a certain date. (Used by the aged invoice report). This is updated during the CashReceipt posting process, Adjustment entry or Apply Credit memos programs..

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CreditMemo
member.summary: Indicates the type of document. Yes = Credit Memo No= Invoice. This value can't be changed after the record has been created. Credit memos affect the way detail quantities and amounts are stored in the database. They will always be stored with a negative sign but will entered as a positive. Credit Memos created by invoice entry also set the InvoiceSuffix field = "CM"

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.UnappliedCash
member.summary: An internal flag that represents Credit Memo was due to Unapplied Receipts. Created by the Cash Receipts Entry program. This is only applicable with CreditMemo = Yes.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CheckRef
member.summary: The Check reference number that the Unapplied Receipt Credit Memo was created from. Cash receipts entry sets this field equal to the CashHead.CheckRef when it creates the Unapplied Receipt Credit Memo. Primarily used as a reference. This is used when TranType = PrePay, MisPay or PayInv.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceSuffix
member.summary: An internally assigned field that further identifies an invoice. This field will be displayed as a suffix to the invoice number. The possible values are "CM" = Credit memo created by invoice entry, UR = Unapplied Receipt Credit Memo, DN = Debit Note, and FC = Finance Charge invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.GroupID
member.summary: The Group that the invoice was associated with during the data entry process. This field is not directly maintainable, it is assigned by the invoice entry program using the BatchID of the "current " batch that the user is working with.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.Posted
member.summary: Indicates if this invoice has been Posted to the receivables file. Only invoices that have been Posted (true) will be included as part of the open receivables, that is they will not appear on reports or inquiries other than those used within invoice entry. Otherwise they are considered as still being in data entry. This field is always "no" when the invoice is created. It is set to "yes" by the "Post function". Once an invoice is posted it can't be maintained via data entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceNum
member.summary: If this field is left blank the system assigns the next available #. The next available # is the greater of last # on file plus one or the XaSyst.StartInvNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceType
member.summary: There are four types of invoices: "Shp" = Invoice for Shipment, "Adv" = Advanced Billing, "Dep" = For Deposit Payments, and "Mis" = Miscellaneous. The setting of this field affects invoice entry: "Shipments" - These are generated by the "Get Shipments function" and is not selectable directly by the user. "Advanced" - Must have a sales order reference. The detail lines on this type of invoice update the OrderDtl.AdvanceBillBal. Also the user indicates if this should be considered as deferred revenue. Which changes which G/L accounts are used for the line item credits. "Deposit" invoices are used to request a "deposit" on an order. A Sales Order is mandatory. No line items or Miscellaneous records are allowed. The user enters a flat amount on the header (InvcHead.PrePayAmt) which will be printed in the body of the invoice. This also updates the OrderHed.PrePayBal field. "Miscellaneous" - These invoices may or may not reference a Sales Order. If Invoice is generated in Project Billing then there are following options: "PFF" - Fixed Fee project; "PCP" - Cost Plus project; "PTM" - Time and Material project; "PPP" - Progress Payment project.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DeferredRevenue
member.summary: Only used when InvoiceType = "Adv" (Advanced Billing). Indicates if the detail line amounts are to be considered as sales or deferred revenue. If "No" then the G/L accounts on the detail lines are the Sales Accounts otherwise they will be set to the Deferred Revenue accounts established in the ARSyst/ARAcct files.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.OrderNum
member.summary: Sales Order #. This is a mandatory entry for all InvoiceType except "Miscellaneous". If entered it must be valid in the OrderHed file. The OrderHed supplies the invoice with many defaults, including; CustNum, PONum, TermsCode, FOB, RepRate, RepSplit, SalesRepList, InvoiceComments

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CustNum
member.summary: The CustNum field is the internal # that is used to link the invoice to the Customer master file. This field is not directly maintained by the user. In most cases it will be duplicated from the referenced OrderHed. For "Miscellaneous" invoices the user can enter either a Sales Order Number or a Customer ID which will supply the CustNum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.PONum
member.summary: Customer's PO#. This is a reference field which will be printed on the invoice. Defaults from the OrderHed.PONum.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.EntryPerson
member.summary: User ID that entered the invoice. This is not maintainable by the user.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.FOB
member.summary: Defaults from sales order ORderHed.FOB

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.TermsCode
member.summary: Contains the foreign key to the TERMS master file. Defaults from OrderHed if OrderNum > 0 else from the Customer master. This IS A MANDATORY ENTRY. User maintainable via a combo-box for terms description.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceDate
member.summary: Invoice date is duplicated from the InvcGrp record.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DueDate
member.summary: The due date of the earlist unpaid scheduled payment amount. Normally invoices only have a single due date and amount. However we provide for installment payments which have multiple due dates and associated amounts. When invoices are first created this date will always be equal to the first entry in the DateDueList. Then as transactions are applied this "Current" Due Date is refreshed by figuring out which is the earliest unpaid scheduled payment.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.FiscalYear
member.summary: Fiscal Year is duplicated from the related InvcGrp or based on ShipDate of Packing Slip. This is also refreshed if the InvoiceDate is changed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.FiscalPeriod
member.summary: Fiscal period of invoice. This is duplicated in from the InvcBatc or during the "get shipments" function it is determined based on the ShipDate of the packing slip or when the invoice date is changed. It is overrideable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.GLPosted
member.summary: Once posted, maintenance is not allowed.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceComment
member.summary: Used to establish invoice comments about the overall order. These will copied into the Invoice detail file as defaults.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceAmt
member.summary: Total invoice Amount. This field is an accumulation of the extended net amounts of the detail line items (InvcDtl) and of the miscellaneous charges/credits (InvcMisc) records. This field has a true sign. (credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DocInvoiceAmt
member.summary: Total invoice Amount. This field is an accumulation of the extended net amounts of the detail line items (InvcDtl) and of the miscellaneous charges/credits (InvcMisc) records. This field has a true sign. (credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DocInvoiceBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.UnpostedBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance which includes the unposted cash receipt amounts. This balance is updated immediately as cash is applied to the invoice, while the InvoiceBal field is not updated until the cash is posted. Used by cash receipts to validate online that an invoice is not over paid. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DocUnpostedBal
member.summary: Current outstanding balance which includes the unposted cash receipt amounts. This balance is updated immediately as cash is applied to the invoice, while the InvoiceBal field is not updated until the cash is posted. Used by cash receipts to validate online that an invoice is not over paid. Carries a true sign. (Credit memos are negative).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DepositCredit
member.summary: Amount to be credited against the invoice total due to deposit payments against the sales order. This can be defaulted from OrderHed.DepositBal. This will be printed on the invoice as a separate line "Less Deposit of:" This value updates the OrderHed.DepositBal. Do not allow OrderHed.DepositBal to become negative.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DocDepositCredit
member.summary: Amount to be credited against the invoice total due to deposit payments against the sales order. This can be defaulted from OrderHed.DepositBal. This will be printed on the invoice as a separate line "Less Deposit of:" This value updates the OrderHed.DepositBal. Do not allow OrderHed.DepositBal to become negative.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.SalesRepList
member.summary: Stores the Sales Rep Codes for the invoice. Up to five codes can be established. This field is not directly maintainable. Instead temp widgets are used for entry of each individual code and then put together as one comma delimited string field and assigned to this field. This field will have a Word index, it then will make reporting and data base integrity checking much easier through the use of the "contains phrase" when retrieving records. These codes can be left blank or must be valid in the SalesRep master. The defaults are based on the OrderHed.SalesRepList if a valid Order is referenced or first one is defaulted from the Customer master if ship to is blank else from the ShipTo.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceRef
member.summary:
This field is maintainable/viewable only for Credit Memos. It represents the invoice # that this credit memo relates to. It can be left blank. If entered it must be a valid InvcHead record where the InvcHead.CreditMemo = No. This field is also used to order the invoices when printing aging reports. The idea is to be able to print the credit memos next to their corresponding invoice. Therefore, this field will always have a value.
For Invoices it is equal to the InvoiceNum.
For Credit memos where they are not related to an invoice it is also set equal to the credit memo's InvoiceNum. In this later case when InvcHead.Credit = Yes and InvcHead.InvoiceNum = InvcHead.InvoiceRef the InvoiceRef is reset to zero before being displayed, then when written back to the database it is set = to the InvoiceNum if the user did not enter a related invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.RefCancelled
member.summary: Value of this field is reference to invoice which has been cancelled by current invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.RefCancelledBy
member.summary: Value of this field is reference to invoice that cancelled this invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.StartUp
member.summary: An internal flag to indicate if this invoice was created by the Open Invoice Load program. These records are not maintainable/viewable via invoice entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.PayDates
member.summary: Contains the "list" of due dates for the scheduled payments. Delimited by the character defined in the "List-Delim" variable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.PayAmounts
member.summary: The scheduled payment amounts. Corresponds with the PayDates list. Delimited by the character defined in the "list-delim" variable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DocPayAmounts
member.summary: The scheduled payment amounts. Corresponds with the PayDates list. Delimited by the character defined in the "list-delim" variable.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.PayDiscDate
member.summary: Prompt payment discount date. This is calculated based on the Invoice date + Terms.DiscountDays. Not user maintainable. This will default into the cash receipt record if the scheduled due amount is being paid in full.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.PayDiscAmt
member.summary: Amount of discount that would be given if paid on or before the specified PayDiscDate. Calculated using the Terms.DiscountPercent X Invoice total amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DocPayDiscAmt
member.summary: Amount of discount that would be given if paid on or before the specified PayDiscDate. Calculated using the Terms.DiscountPercent X Invoice total amount.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.BillConNum
member.summary: Contains the key value for the Billing Contact. This can be blank or it must be valid in the CUSTCNT table. Use the CUSTOMER.PRIMBCON as the default.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.InvoiceHeld
member.summary: Invoices that are within a data entry group can be put on "Hold". They will not be posted until InvoiceHeld=No. This flag can be used for whatever the reason the user may wish to keep an invoice in a data entry group from being posted. The Manufacturing System sets this flag when creating invoices for order line items which had been flagged for "Time & Material Invoicing" (OrderDtl.TMBilling)

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CurrencyCode
member.summary: A unique code that identifies the currency.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.ExchangeRate
member.summary: Exchange rate that will be used for this invoice. Defaults from CurrRate.CurrentRate. Conversion rates will be calculated as System Base = Foreign value * rate, Foreign value = system base * (1/rate). This is the dollar in foreign currency from the exchange rate tables in the newspapers.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.LockRate
member.summary: Used with the currency module. When TRUE the currency rate can be changed by the user and cannot be changed by the system. This will also be the default for the invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.JournalNum
member.summary: Journal number that invoice was posted to. This can also be thought of as the Voucher Number. If ARSyst.ARVoucherInvoices = Yes then this value will be printed on the Invoice. Note: applicable only when posted to G/L.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.JournalCode
member.summary: Journal that invoice was posted to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.LineType
member.summary: Used to differentiate between invoiced with standard lines which are for parts "PART" and lines for service calls "CALL" .

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.RMANum
member.summary: The RMA number which generated this Credit Memo. Note: This only applies to Credit Memos. It is assigned as part of the Request Credit process for an RMA and is not directly maintainable by Invoice Entry.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.Plant
member.summary: The Site that the invoice is relate to.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CardMemberName
member.summary: The member's name on the credit card.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CardNumber
member.summary: The credit card account identifier.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CardType
member.summary: A code assigned by the user to uniquely identify a Credit Card Type master. This can't be blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.ExpirationMonth
member.summary: The expiration month of the credit card.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.ExpirationYear
member.summary: The expiration year of the credit card.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CardID
member.summary: Optional field, a 4-digit, non-embossed code on face of American Express Card assigned for fraud prevention.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.CardmemberReference
member.summary: Up to 17 alphnumeric characters provided by customer. This is used to track information on customer spending (e.g., cost center, project code). This field is especially critical, since inaccurate information will affect the general ledger. If no reference number is provided, leave this field blank.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.LegalNumber
member.summary: The Legal Number for the record. This number is created based on setup parameters in table LegalNumber.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.ExternalID
member.summary: External Identifier

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.XRefInvoiceNum
member.summary: Cross reference invoice number used when converting data from another ERP system when the previous system data has alphanumeric content. This field is not used by MfgSys. This field can be used in searches and can be added to screens through customization.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DepGainLoss
member.summary: Wherever the Less Advanced or Less Deposited is calculated, put any gain-loss difference into this field.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DNComments
member.summary: For the Debit Note invoices this field contains the detail comments for the Debit Note. For the regular invoices this field contains the list of Debit Notes related to this invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DNCustNbr
member.summary: For the Debit Note invoice this field contains A Debit Note number assigned by the customer. The Debit Note number is supposed to be unique for the customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.DebitNote
member.summary: Indicates the type of documents. Yes = Debit Note. This value can't be changed (the record is created on Invoice payment posting). Debit Notes also have the InvoiceSuffix field = "DN".

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.SoldToCustNum
member.summary: This is populated from ShipHead.CustNum representing the Sold To customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.Consolidated
member.summary: Default is false. This is only set to true if this invoice was generated via Get Shipments and shipments were combined based on common Bill To customer. This is used by ARInvoice Entry to properly enable/disable Bill To customer field (InvcHead.CustNum) and to identify the record as a consolidated Invoice.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.BillToInvoiceAddress
member.summary: If InvcHead.CustNum (BillTo) is different from InvcHead.SoldToCustNum (SoldTo), then this field defaults to the CustBillTo (Alt BillTo). InvoiceAddress status and SoldToInvoiceAddress is set to the opposite status.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.SoldToInvoiceAddress
member.summary: Always the opposite status of BillToInvoiceAddress. If true, Invoice address for printing will use the Bill To address on the Sold-to customer. If false, will use the Bill To address of the Bill to customer.

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.ProcessCard
member.summary: Stores the encrypted credit card number

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.RepComm1
member.summary: Contains the total commission amount for the corresponding sales rep (SalesRepList). This total is NOT MAINTAINABLE. It is updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain this total; If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount) * RepSplit) * RepRate).

member.name: P:Erp.Tablesets.InvcHeadListRow.RepSales1
member.summary: An array of five elements containing the total invoice sales amount for the corresponding sales reps (SalesRepList). These totals are NOT MAINTAINABLE. They are updated via write triggers on the InvcDtl record. The following basic formula is used to maintain these totals: If InvcDtl.Commissionable = Yes then the sales amount to accumulate is calculated as (((ShipQty/PriceFactor) * UnitPrice) - Discount . NOTE: miscellaneous charges/credits are NOT part of the sales total.
